content.description:
Southie climbs a featured overhang on excellent sandstone.

Sit sit with hands matched on the sloping mini-shelf (there is a small positive lip for at least part of one hand). From there, pop up to a left hand pinch, follow with a right hand to the irregular bumps at the arete, then stick a left hand gaston to a perfect incut, cross over with the right to the diagonal edge, match, then go for the bumps at the lip, throw a left foot onto the lip, reach the good left hand edge and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well, the landing is perfect.
content.location: Southie climbs the south facing overhang of Southie Boulder.

content.description:
Iconoclast traverses a short, slightly overhung face on solid edges.

Stand start with a with a high left hand edge and a right hand below on an edge. From there, either make a big dyno out right to the edge at the arete, or use an intermediate incut edge before dynoing. Once at the arete, use the good bumps to roll around onto the slab, and top out.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Southie.
